no matter how much you're prepared intellectually for the restoration of fallingwater the sight of that iconic living room deconstructed still takes your breath away. furniture has been removed to the visitors' center cafe now closed for the season for conservation. the flagstones that cover the living room and two flanking terraces more than 600 of them have been mapped numbered taken up and stacked inside three plastic sheds on the path from the visitors' center to the house.

to stop the deflection silman determined there was only one pragmatic solution strengthen three of the four concrete beams under the living room with a post tensioning system that will hold them tautly in place. site changes designed to enhance the visitors' experience include creating a new trail to provide a bird's eye view overlooking the house from across bear run accessed by a boardwalk hugging the hillside. the fallingwater restoration team includes structural engineer robert silman associates new york ny and washington d. c. post tensioning consultant schupack suarez engineers inc. norwalk ct post tensioning contractor vstructural llc springfield va architect wank adams slavin associates llp new york ny architectural contractor j. l.

installation view of print out i found a printmaking wonderland on the top floor of moma. print out is a showcase the new direction that printmaking has taken in the past two decade bringing together artists of all skill levels in printmaking. much of the exhibition was hung salon style with some works hung so close to the floor that they might as well have been resting on it while others so high out of view they appeared to nearly be touching the ceiling.

installation view of print out i found a printmaking wonderland on the top floor of moma. print out is a showcase the new direction that printmaking has taken in the past two decade bringing together artists of all skill levels in printmaking. many of the artists featured in print out are not formally trained printmakers their work is highly experimental which sheds a new light on the medium.

installation view of print out i found a printmaking wonderland on the top floor of moma. many of the artists featured in print out are not formally trained printmakers their work is highly experimental which sheds a new light on the medium. these galleries were rough for me i found it hard to focus on the prints with the super busy wallpaper screaming at my eyes form the background.
installation view of print out
installation view of print out
installation view of print out

installation view of print out print out features a variety of printmaking media such as etchings screenprints and even seemingly found ephemera. the work in the exhibition emphasizes the central qualities of printmaking the ease of reproducibility and distribution. through their artists interventions museum in progress is questioning the use and value of ephemera.

installation view of print out print out features a variety of printmaking media such as etchings screenprints and even seemingly found ephemera. the work in the exhibition emphasizes the central qualities of printmaking the ease of reproducibility and distribution. museum in progress a vienna based organization commissions artists interventions in newspapers and magazines a wall of which appears in print out.

the work in the exhibition emphasizes the central qualities of printmaking the ease of reproducibility and distribution. museum in progress a vienna based organization commissions artists interventions in newspapers and magazines a wall of which appears in print out. museum in progress seeks to push beyond the walls of institutions by placing work in newspapers magazines websites and billboards.
rirkrit tiravanija. demonstration n 1. 2003

superflex. copy light factory. by utilizing existing print practices superflux pushes the boundaries of the medium.
superflex. copy light factory. 2008 by utilizing printmakings innate function of reproducibility artist group superflex created the participatory based project copy light factory.

2008 by utilizing printmakings innate function of reproducibility artist group superflex created the participatory based project copy light factory. this project invites visitors at designated times to enter the workshop and participate in the construction of iconic lighting fixtures assembled from wooden frames and digitally printed images of lamps. by utilizing existing print practices superflux pushes the boundaries of the medium.

images via moma thomas schtte. low tide wandering wattwanderung . furthermore given that this portfolio acts as a kind of response to 9 11 i feel that the navet works well 9 11 brought with it a childlike air of fear and confusion.
images via moma thomas schtte. low tide wandering wattwanderung . 2001 my most favorite part of print out though without a doubt was the thomas schtte gallery.

schtte says that he chose the medium of etching in an effort to switch to the opposite direction in a time dominated by digital technology. for so long printmakers have taken pride in the mastery of the fine art print however with low tide wandering schtte was a novice which is evident in the etchings. furthermore given that this portfolio acts as a kind of response to 9 11 i feel that the navet works well 9 11 brought with it a childlike air of fear and confusion.
images via moma thomas schtte. low tide wandering wattwanderung . the print out catalogue is an excellent representation of the exhibition and definitely worthy of a browse. suzanne minatra
pushing the boundaries of printmaking at moma
images via moma thomas schtte. low tide wandering wattwanderung . 2001 on a final note i must mention the exhibition catalogue.
pushing the boundaries of printmaking at moma

im a sucker for exhibition catalogues in general but i was super impressed with that of print out. right down to the dot pattern of the wallpaper that i mentioned earlier that carries over into the catalogue appearing and disappearing throughout the pages just as it did throughout the galleries. the print out catalogue is an excellent representation of the exhibition and definitely worthy of a browse. suzanne minatra

the fluorescent green takes away from that a bit but the shield the balance composition the skyline all add up to create a legitimately good logo. the disc is on a bias but it moves the eye into the type which is arced up into the skyline. there is no unnecessary skeuomorphism no beveled embossed type or heavy dropshadows.

sunrise 7 08 there are a lot of wonderful things about travel. coming from maine one of the best parts of travel is that almost anywhere you go the sunrise is a bit later than at home. after a move from the high rises of downtown to the sprawl of mid town an area that feels more like suburbs to me i found my sunrise sky.
not bad. here is our pre dawn mid town view of downtown

houston is a pretty major sports hub and two big arenas caught my eye as a walking tourist. the toyota center home of the houston rockets has a lovely circular tribute garden dedicated to hakeem olajuwon. nearby is a basketball park that offered a nice view of downtown shrouded in clouds.

houston is a pretty major sports hub and two big arenas caught my eye as a walking tourist. the toyota center home of the houston rockets has a lovely circular tribute garden dedicated to hakeem olajuwon. nearby is a basketball park that offered a nice view of downtown shrouded in clouds.

houston is a pretty major sports hub and two big arenas caught my eye as a walking tourist. the toyota center home of the houston rockets has a lovely circular tribute garden dedicated to hakeem olajuwon. nearby is a basketball park that offered a nice view of downtown shrouded in clouds.

minute maid park the baseball hub is built on to the old union station a train station designed by the same guy that designed grand central station in new york. now those grand days of train travel are gone and the pillared foyer only serves as an entryway to the ball park. biggio played his entire 19 year career with the houston astros.

minute maid park the baseball hub is built on to the old union station a train station designed by the same guy that designed grand central station in new york. now those grand days of train travel are gone and the pillared foyer only serves as an entryway to the ball park. outside a statue of craig biggio hurls a ball to the first baseman across the way.

now those grand days of train travel are gone and the pillared foyer only serves as an entryway to the ball park. outside a statue of craig biggio hurls a ball to the first baseman across the way. biggio played his entire 19 year career with the houston astros.
the historic district was somewhat disappointing. some people complain that houston has wreaked havoc with its historical architecture. building in the city that still sits in its original site.
the historic district was somewhat disappointing. some people complain that houston has wreaked havoc with its historical architecture. very few early buildings still stand.
some people complain that houston has wreaked havoc with its historical architecture. very few early buildings still stand. building in the city that still sits in its original site.

one of the most unusual things to me about houston was its multi level world. there are skyways and tunnels like lacework all over the city above and below. a bit claustrophobic for me and it seemed weird that so many people were spending time underground when there is perfectly nice fresh air outdoors.

one of the most unusual things to me about houston was its multi level world. there are skyways and tunnels like lacework all over the city above and below. the tunnels reminded me of airport terminals endless rows of shops and restaurants except there are no windows in sight.

one of the most unusual things to me about houston was its multi level world. the tunnels reminded me of airport terminals endless rows of shops and restaurants except there are no windows in sight. a bit claustrophobic for me and it seemed weird that so many people were spending time underground when there is perfectly nice fresh air outdoors.

so i headed outside the city and visited hermann park. i skirted the edges of rice university and got a little choo choo train tour of hermann park where there are monuments lakes an outdoor theater and museums. and of course there are very cute squirrels.

there are also lots of live oaks. live oak trees are one of my favorite things about the south. but even in the 1800's this 400 year old tree was already a venerable old creature.

there are also lots of live oaks. live oak trees are one of my favorite things about the south. that exquisite tortuously twisted and gnarled branchwork evokes an intensely expressive character in these trees.

that exquisite tortuously twisted and gnarled branchwork evokes an intensely expressive character in these trees. though there are conflicting versions of the tales some call this the hanging tree of houston. ostensibly many men were hanged from its branches in the early days of the republic of texas.

my next adventure is a long weekend in new york and my travelling companion is my eighteen year old son kieran. for him it is a long anticipated birthday end of school present. avengers trailer

my next adventure is a long weekend in new york and my travelling companion is my eighteen year old son kieran. for him it is a long anticipated birthday end of school present. when i was last in new york it was four years ago with my daughter and that trip was memorable for queuing to get into abercrombie amp fitch trips to bloomingdales and incursions to a number of other 5th avenue retailers who cater for a market of brand victims indulging in overpriced fashion and pretentious carrier bags.

thankfully on this occasion our itinerary was somewhat less conventional and included a trip to the forbidden planet comic book store a super heroes walking tour a comedy club and an obscene dinner at the dinosaur bbq restaurant in harlem. amongst them were three geeky aussie blokes about my age a mother and daughter from california and a younger couple from alabama and judging from the fancy carrier bags the lady had just spent the morning shopping and her husband a superhero fan was now getting his treat. for the last day we did strawberry fields central park to see the john lennon memorial the natural history museum and walked about two miles to a famous new york cheese cake bakery worth every step.

more pictures still coming .
at the freedom tower whew! that was quite a whirlwind trip to new york! we enjoyed the better part of 3 days in nyc so it worked out well.
more pictures still coming .
at the freedom tower whew! that was quite a whirlwind trip to new york! janet and i arrived from toronto at 9 am friday.
more pictures still coming .

it was bitterly cold except for yesterday when we could finally walk around. we dropped our bags off at the roosevelt hotel at 45 5th streets about 10 am. our 16th floor room was typically new york sized small but quite adequate and the price was right 2 nights for about 800 cdn each including round trip air flight.
the empire state building our first stop was the empire state building. it was built shorty after the hotel. i think so.

the empire state building our first stop was the empire state building. it was built shorty after the hotel. janet has always wanted to go up to the top but there's been a huge crowd with maybe even a two or three hour wait.

janet has always wanted to go up to the top but there's been a huge crowd with maybe even a two or three hour wait. this time since it was very very cold and windy we walked in and went straight up. there's a forest of sky scrappers on every side.
empire state building view of manhattan next we took a cab over the williamsburg bridge to the first music store on my list rough trade nyc. it just opened here recently. nice score!

empire state building view of manhattan next we took a cab over the williamsburg bridge to the first music store on my list rough trade nyc. it just opened here recently. i've been to both london england locations.

empire state building view of manhattan next we took a cab over the williamsburg bridge to the first music store on my list rough trade nyc. shopping in new york was not exactly cheap even discounting the drop in the canadian dollar compared to the last visit in summer 2011. it's too bad that the rough trade cafe wasn't open. i bought a very hard to find used copy of dub soundscapes shattered songs in jamaican reggae by michael e veal like in the sandwich!

from the empire state building looking towards the 9 11 site it was dark by now as we cabbed over to the world trade centre 9 11 memorial site. the new brightly lit freedom tower loomed far overhead in the dark quite the site to behold. we both liked the club sandwiches steak burgers and fish n' chips.

from the empire state building looking towards the 9 11 site it was dark by now as we cabbed over to the world trade centre 9 11 memorial site. the new brightly lit freedom tower loomed far overhead in the dark quite the site to behold. it's open for business during working hours but sightseers won't be allowed in until next june or july.

the new brightly lit freedom tower loomed far overhead in the dark quite the site to behold. it's open for business during working hours but sightseers won't be allowed in until next june or july. we took another cab back to the roosevelt hotel then walked over to grand central station looking for the record mart the next music store on my list.
officer! please arrest the mad man in that car . that one too! the very heart of the modern day american babylon.
officer! please arrest the mad man in that car . that one too! that night the heat was cranked up high in our hotel room.

everything was pretty much just expensive but there are all sorts of discounts if you sign up for a macy's card. we only qualified for a 10 discount as canucks not 20 like a registered visitor with a macy's card and so on. to make a long story short janet found a very nice pair of rayban sunglasses for the beach.
times square was jam packed with folks walking up and down the strip just hanging out even in the bitter cold. most of the trashy souvenir stores are gone. very much so.

times square was jam packed with folks walking up and down the strip just hanging out even in the bitter cold. most of the trashy souvenir stores are gone. it's now jam packed tight with big box stores open to all hours in the city that never sleeps.

times square was jam packed with folks walking up and down the strip just hanging out even in the bitter cold. it's now jam packed tight with big box stores open to all hours in the city that never sleeps. for reasons unknown they are digging up the centre of both the street and square packing everyone very tightly onto the crowded sidewalks.
time square our highlight sunday was a visit by cab to the 9 11 site again. we tried to use the subway maps token machines iphone apps etc. it's now the tallest building in new york.
time square our highlight sunday was a visit by cab to the 9 11 site again. we tried to use the subway maps token machines iphone apps etc. found it too overwhelming.

many of the surrounding buildings have been torn down and rebuilt in a late post modern style i'd think. the nearly finished freedom tower resembles a sheet of mirrored glass stretching up pointing to the sky. i saw a fairly low flying jet arc overhead leaving behind a ghostly smoke plume silhouetted against the tower in it's wake.

i really like how the twin tower foundations remain as just 2 gaping holes surrounded by sidewalks and open green space. there are waterfalls pouring down all four sides. i saw a small canadian flag flapping over one in the stiff breeze.

i really like how the twin tower foundations remain as just 2 gaping holes surrounded by sidewalks and open green space. there are waterfalls pouring down all four sides. the outer edges have the names of the dead stretching the whole length of the walls.

i really like how the twin tower foundations remain as just 2 gaping holes surrounded by sidewalks and open green space. the outer edges have the names of the dead stretching the whole length of the walls. thinking about it still chokes me up. the names are carved deep into the metal ledges and people stick little flowers in them.

janet wanted to go shopping at century 21. like a souped up macey's it is pricey and vastly overrated. she didn't buy much. the prices are about the same in toronto although there was more variety than in most stores.
janet wanted to go shopping at century 21. like a souped up macey's it is pricey and vastly overrated. she didn't buy much. there is a record bar downstairs.

janet wanted to go shopping at century 21. like a souped up macey's it is pricey and vastly overrated. janet wanted to take pictures of an architecturally unique skyscraper the former 1904 breslin hotel which is being incorporating into the design of a building in toronto. i walked around inside a bit too then went across the street to a retail wholesaler at the corner of broadway and west 29th who specializes in e vapourizers and other groovy related medical paraphernalia to cool the nerves or whatever ails you.

roosevelt hotel lobby we relaxed in the lobby of the roosevelt hotel just enjoying the splendour for a bit. watching folk come and go. still i'd definitely give our new york city adventure a big two thumbs up!

roosevelt hotel lobby we relaxed in the lobby of the roosevelt hotel just enjoying the splendour for a bit. watching folk come and go. then we took a cab back early to laguardia just in case it was busy so as to try avoid the rush.

i had a nice fried chicken dinner a meaty leg with two sides potatoes and corn. our airplane arrived on time but was then late getting out onto the runway where we got stuck in a long queue of jets. now i can relax space out just listen to my new records and read my dub book for the next few days.
